_comment: Example: How to customize readability settings for your campaign
_instructions: 1. Copy this example to readability-settings.json (or edit existing file)
2. Set campaignSettings.enabled = true to activate your custom settings
3. Add content types under campaignSettings.contentTypes to override defaults
4. Only specify content types you want to customize - others use defaults

defaultSettings.comment: Default readability targets - do not modify unless you want to change system defaults
defaultSettings.description: Grade level tolerance determines how strict the readability check is. 1.0 = within 1 grade level is acceptable.

campaignSettings.comment: CAMPAIGN CUSTOMIZATION: Set enabled=true and add your overrides below

_example_scenarios._scenario_1: Progressive campaign targeting younger, diverse voters - simpler language
_example_scenarios._scenario_2: Policy-focused campaign for educated district - more sophisticated
_example_scenarios._scenario_3: Rural campaign emphasizing accessibility - very simple language

press_release.note: Accessible to all voters - our campaign prioritizes clarity

speech.note: Town halls and community events - conversational tone

campaignSettings.description: Stricter tolerance - we want to stay very close to target

press_release.note: Educated suburban district - can handle complexity

policy_document.note: Policy wonks and activists appreciate detail

campaignSettings.description: More relaxed - allow more variation in complexity

_tips: 7-8: General public (middle school) - RECOMMENDED for most campaigns
0.5: Very strict - must be very close to target
